edge: The main theme song 'Le Festin' is about the character Ratatouille and his dream to be a chef, as written by composer Michael Giacchino for the movie with the same name.
The character Ratatouille is based on the main character Remy, as shown in the movie. Remy is also associated with a theme written by Michael Giacchino about him and his rat colony.
Composer Michael Giacchino has written a buddy theme for both Remy and Linguini that plays when they are together, as revealed in the movie.
French artist Camille was hired to perform 'Le Festin' after composer Michael Giacchino realized she was perfect for the song, as mentioned in the movie context.
The track 'Welcome to Gusteau's' is related to the character Ratatouille and his association with the restaurant Gusteau's, as shown in the movie.
The track 'Granny Get Your Gun' is related to the character Ratatouille and his rat colony, as shown in the movie.

The track 'Souped Up' is related to the character Ratatouille and his rat colony, as shown in the movie.
The track 'Is It Soup Yet?' is related to the character Ratatouille and his rat colony, as shown in the movie.
The track 'A New Deal' is related to the character Ratatouille and his new deal, as shown in the movie.
